conclusion: To determine which blocks ball A will collide with and its final landing position, we need to consider the effects of gravity, collision, and deflection.
Gravity causes ball A to fall vertically downwards.
The image shows ball A falling towards a group of blocks placed on a table. The blocks are green, orange, blue, and yellow, with yellow blocks positioned closest to ball A.
Ball A will collide with one of the yellow blocks first due to its position.
The collision with the upper yellow block will cause ball A to experience a deflection.
The deflection may cause ball A to come into contact with the lower yellow block.
After the collisions, ball A is likely to settle between or on top of the yellow blocks depending on the angle and force of the impact.
Ball A will collide with the yellow blocks and come to rest on or between them.
